intro: Sonchus angustifolius, commonly known as narrowleaf sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features alternate, lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, followed by spiny, bristly seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
